ygData.subject: Re: fun with charm
ygData.msgSnippet: The only problem with that strategy is that sometimes the critters will ignore your pet and come straight for you...
ygData.messageBody:
The only problem with that strategy is that sometimes the critters will
ignore your pet and come straight for you...

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Scott Murawski [SMTP:scott@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, June 01, 1999 3:37 PM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] fun with charm
>
> From: Scott Murawski <scott@...>
>
> >From: Brewhaus <brewhaus@...>
> >How about this. If you charm a magical being, like a wisp, than have it
> >attack, would the thing it is fighting be able to hit it? This could be
> >used to take on much higher level creatures that couldn't hit magical.
> >Might be a sort of cheat. I don't know.
>
> Man, thats a great idea. I bet it would make for a GREAT screen shot if
> you had that
> wisp attack a kerran spider on wisp isle. If you do it right, loads of
> spiders would train.
>
> Hmm, I wonder if a wisp could kill one of those kerran natives.
>
> Question about when charmed pets kill something. Do you get a faction
> hit?
>
> Azboklin the enchanter
>
